item.title: Israel to open two temporary humanitarian routes into Gaza
item.description: The Erez crossing and Ashdod port will be opened for humanitarian aid deliveries.

item.title: Serbia police arrest 2 men accused of hitting 2-year-old girl with car and dumping her body
item.description: Serbian authorities continue to search for the body of the toddler Danka Ilic, who was reported missing last month.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 5th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Finland to keep its border closed with Russia over migration concerns
item.description: Finland closed the 1,340-kilometer land border late last year after an unusually high number of asylum-seekers entered the country.

item.title: Macron: France and allies 'could have stopped' 1994 Rwanda genocide
item.description: In a statement, French President Emmanuel Macron said France and its allies could have done more to stop the 1994 Rwandan genocide.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 4th – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Russian human rights defender Oleg Orlov turns 71 in prison
item.description: Russia's oldest human rights organisation has said the critic of the war in Ukraine is being treated inhumanely.

item.title: WATCH: Around 1,000 migrants land in Lampedusa in 24 hours
item.description: Dozens of small boats from Tunisia and Libya were also rescued off the Italian island overnight.

item.title: At least 4 killed in Russian drone attacks on Kharkiv
item.description: Ukraine's second-largest city also suffered aerial attacks on its power plant, part of a pattern of strikes on civilian energy infrastructure.

item.title: I am running for the next UN Secretary-General. This is why my bid matters
item.description: The UN chief is chosen in an opaque process by countries seeking to uphold the status quo without any public involvement. This results in the selection of the person that will upset the least, or appease the most of those hyper-polarized powers, Colombe Cahen-Salvador writes.

item.title: Italian Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini survives no-confidence vote
item.description: The far-right politician has been accused of having links with the Kremlin - something he now strenuously denies.

item.title: Judges urge UK government to halt arms sales to Israel after aid convoy strike
item.description: Rishi Sunak is one of many world leaders under pressure to reassess his government's support for Israel.

item.title: As NATO turns 75, this is how it can overcome complacency and reinforce transatlantic security
item.description: The take-home message is that another 75 years of NATO really shouldn’t be taken for granted, Dylan Macchiarini Crosson writes.

item.title: Huge unexploded WWII bomb discovered in Germany
item.description: The discovery of the half-tonne device in Cologne's Rhine River during construction led to shipping closures and evacuations.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 4th – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Taiwanese TV presenter reports an earthquake live as it shakes her studio
item.description: Taiwan’s SETTV captured the moment a 7.2-magnitude earthquake hit on Wednesday morning live as anchorwomen described strong shaking while trying to keep their balance.

item.title: Landmines are being used again. Bold UN action must help their post-conflict victims
item.description: A generation after the Ottawa mine ban treaty, a new conflict sees the use of land mines rise again. The new UN Human Rights Council action could be used to hold states accountable in post-war decontamination and support for victims, six notable human rights advocates write.

item.title: Croatian retailers raise the alarm over effects of Sunday trading law
item.description: The summer's tourism season promises will test how much the country's economy relies on shops staying open all week.

item.title: Migrants relocated from Paris ahead of Olympic Games
item.description: Aid groups fear the move, which included mostly women and children, is the beginning of a broader effort by Paris authorities to clear people out by the summer.

item.title: NATO foreign ministers debate plan to give alliance new power over Europe's Ukraine response
item.description: The alliance's 75th anniversary comes as as Europe faces its largest war in decades.

item.title: Georgian ruling party plans to resubmit controversial 'foreign influence' bill
item.description: In response to the decision to bring back the controversial “foreign agents law” - a move previously halted by mass protests - pro-democracy organisations have called for demonstrations.

item.title: Gaza: Anger at aid convoy strike continues as IRC warns of threat to humanitarian workers
item.description: Updates from Israel's offensive in Gaza.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 4th – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Finland and Ukraine sign long-term security agreement
item.description: The defence aid package provided to Ukraine by Helsinki is worth 188 million euros

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 3rd – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Bullying motive for Finland school shooting that killed 12-year-old boy
item.description: The Finnish government declared Wednesday a nationwide day of mourning, ordering state agencies and institutions to lower the national flag to half-mast.

item.title: Cause of deadly Istanbul nightclub fire suggested by authorities
item.description: Local media reported parts of the under-renovation club were like a “labyrinth,” making it difficult for the victims to escape the blaze.

item.title: Ukraine lowers conscription age as Russia gears up for possible offensive
item.description: Ukraine lowered its age of conscription on Wednesday to bolster its depleted military after two years of grinding war with Moscow.

item.title: This Ramadan, Muslim world can end gender apartheid in Afghanistan
item.description: The Taliban's authority hinges on their purported adherence to Islamic law. However, that is based on a fundamentally flawed, selective and extreme interpretation of Islamic texts, meaning their policies are against their own stated principles, Dr Mohammad bin Abdulkarim Al Issa writes.

item.title: Buildings crumple as Taiwan rocked by strongest earthquake in 25 years
item.description: Taiwan’s earthquake monitoring agency said it was a 7.2 magnitude quake.

item.title: WATCH: Severe weather rips through US
item.description: Significant rain storms and three suspected tornados lashed nine US states on Tuesday.

item.title: NATO mulls long-term military support plan for Ukraine
item.description: The debate comes as better armed Russian troops assert dominance on the battlefield.

item.title: WATCH: Warehouse in Taipei crumbles into rubble after earthquake
item.description: There were no immediate reports of deaths or injuries. Train service was suspended across the island of 23 million people.

item.title: Luis Rubiales detained at Madrid airport in corruption investigation
item.description: The controversy-prone former president of the Spanish football federation was arrested as part of a corruption investigation.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 3rd – Midday
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Blinken bolsters Ukraine: 'Absolutely essential' to send weapons
item.description: The US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said it was "absolutely essential" to send weapons to Ukraine on a trip to an arms factory in France.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 3rd – Morning
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Taiwan hit by strongest quake in 25 years, killing at least 9 people
item.description: Taiwan’s earthquake monitoring agency gave the magnitude as 7.2 while the US Geological Survey put it at 7.4.

item.title: Bodies of six foreign aid workers killed in Israeli airstrike moved out of Gaza
item.description: Seven aid workers from World Central Kitchen were killed on Monday in an Israeli airstrike as they delivered food to Gaza.

item.title: Portugal’s new government aims to outmanoeuvre radical populist rivals
item.description: Portugal's center-right minority government began its term on Tuesday, facing challenges and opportunities after a radical right party's popularity surged.

item.title: Conference opens up pathway for Ukraine's war victims to claim compensation
item.description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba addressed the Restoring Justice for Ukraine conference in the Hague on Tuesday, telling delegates the people of Ukraine ''want to see justice delivered''.

item.title: WATCH: Musical medic students perform at Gold Coast hospital
item.description: The corridors of a Gold Coast hospital are filled with beautiful sounds, offering a much-welcomed respite for some patients.

item.title: In Bucha, moving on remains struggle two years after liberation
item.description: Many Ukraninans in Bucha are struggling to come to terms with what happened to them and their loved ones.

item.title: Russia planning major new offensive in Donetsk region in coming months, ISW says
item.description: A recent battalion-sized action that was repelled by Ukrainian forces gives an indication of Russia's new priorities.

item.title: Latest news bulletin | April 2nd – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Eight dead after car carrying suspected migrants crashes in Albania
item.description: Albania is a route for some migrants heading for the EU, which is working with the country to close off paths into the bloc.

item.title: Channel opened for vessels clearing collapsed Baltimore bridge site
item.description: The owner and manager of the container ship that crashed into a supporting column one week ago are taking legal action to limit liability.

item.title: Fire at Istanbul nightclub kills at least 29 people
item.description: An investigation into the fire has been launched, and arrest warrants have been issued for 5 suspects.

item.title: Gang and police gunbattles paralyse area near Haiti's National Palace
item.description: At least one policeman was shot after he and other officers were forced to flee an armoured car that was later set on fire, according to local media reports.

item.title: Aid group in Gaza claims Israeli airstrike killed at least six workers
item.description: The workers were allegedly in the process of delivering aid to Gaza's population when they were struck.
